title: Export multiple files with same file name under different directories to zip file fails.
description:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Launch WSWB and create two projects
2. Under each project, create a new file with the same name (such as "foo.txt")
3. From the main menu, select File -> Export and select Zip File to export
4. In the "Export" dialog window, select both projects created earlier, give the zip file a name (such as test.zip), and begin export to zip file.
OB: When exporting multiple files with the same name under different directories to a zip file, an error message box pops up stating that problems were encountered during export. The detail in the error message lists the file of the same name in project2 as the problem.
EB: The export process should complete successfully without any error messages when exporting multiple files with the same name under different directories to a zip file.
SR:
To reproduce:
1. Launch WSWB and create two projects
2. Under each project, create a new file with the same name (such as "foo.txt")
3. From the main menu, select File -> Export and select Zip File to export
4. In the "Export" dialog window, select both projects created earlier, give the zip file a name (such as test.zip), and begin export to zip file.
